name: places/ChIJByMYf9dZwokRoGBpW2dSjmM
formattedAddress: 240 E 59th St 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 240 E 59th St 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text: Dr Park is a terrific doctor. He did a great job on my spinal cord surgery. When we first met he took time to explain everything to me. I’ve had a great result from the surgery. I recommend him.

text.text: Dr Park is a terrific doctor. He did a great job on my spinal cord surgery. When we first met he took time to explain everything to me. I’ve had a great result from the surgery. I recommend him.

originalText.text: Dr. Park and his PA-C Jenna are an incredible team. If I could give them 6-stars I would. I had a microdiscectomy on my L4/L5 and 8-weeks out am feeling incredible. It's wild living in pain and then magically (not really because surgery is involved) not. Dr. Park and his team were knowledgeable, kind, and understanding - working with me, my schedule, and insurance to make sure everything went smoothly. In the end, while happy it is over, I would highly recommend this team to any.

text.text: Dr. Park and his PA-C Jenna are an incredible team. If I could give them 6-stars I would. I had a microdiscectomy on my L4/L5 and 8-weeks out am feeling incredible. Dr. Park and his team were knowledgeable, kind, and understanding - working with me, my schedule, and insurance to make sure everything went smoothly. In the end, while happy it is over, I would highly recommend this team to any.

originalText.text:
Dr. Park was recommended by an existing patient, and my first contact with him was a video consult in April 2023, while I was in Florida.  I found him to be warm and empathetic, listening carefully to my case history, reviewing the MRI findings, and discussing in detail the available options and possible risks.

Absent from my encounters with Dr. Park were the arrogance and condescension I experienced from other surgeons I had previously consulted with for my case.   I concluded that, when the time came for me to elect for surgery (lumbar spinal fusion), he would be my surgeon.

After 1-1/2 years of non-surgical approaches to manage my pain and mobility problems due to lumbar and foraminal stenosis, I had surgery late November 2023.  At six weeks out from surgery I am still observing the cautions to avoid lifting, bending, and twisting, but I can now walk 5 miles daily with very little discomfort, something that was impossible before surgery.

When I was in recovery Dr. Park took the time to call my daughter to let her know that the procedure went well, and he engaged her in detail with her well-informed questions.  I'm grateful to Dr. Park for his skill and ability to look at the whole patient.

originalText.text: Dr. Park has given me my life back. I had a large herniated disc in my lower back that left me mostly bed ridden for the first six months of this year.  I went through PT and got several shots and nothing worked. Surgery was the only option left and I am so glad I found Dr. Park. I was nervous and scared, but Dr. Park was patient and took the time to explain the process. I've seen other surgeons before him and I immediately knew I wanted him to do the surgery. Three months later, I am walking with minimal pain. I was told that nerve damage takes time to heal so I'm just taking it one day at a time, but I am so grateful to be moving again. I also want to say that his team is fantastic as well! From scheduling everything to quick response for any issues or concerns, this is the best medical service I ever received!

originalText.text:
I was referred to Dr. Park after a week-long inpatient stay for limited ambulation and unrelenting pain due to lumbar spinal stenosis and  bulging discs. Prior to hospitalization, my outpatient providers (orthopedic specialist and pain medicine doctor) had also recommended a surgery consult as all other conservative methods had failed.

Dr. Park's PA was personable  and thorough in her collection of background information. Dr.  Park was also initially personable, initiating some small talk before getting into discussing my issues and his recommendations.

Though he seemed intelligent and was good at explaining the facts of my situation, I believe that Dr. Park lacked the empathy that I needed in the moment, particularly as I broke down in tears after hearing his recommendation not to proceed with surgery. While nobody is eager to have spinal surgery, dealing with debilitating pain that severely  impacts my quality of life, and feeling that there is no solution is very discouraging.

Dr. Park essentially told me that he would not recommend surgery because of my age and other factors such as co-ocurring medical issues and my BMI. He suggested I "Hold out" the pain to see if my herniated disc can heal itself. He also attemped to highlight that my pain was "better" than when I was in the hospital because I was now able to walk and resume work, even though I explained that the only reason I was now abulating is because I was sent home with a 14-day opioid prescription, which is clearly only a temporary bandaid for the issue. For someone who has been dealing with pain for months on end and being a Black woman which carries its own history of our pain experiences not being believed, it is very triggering to feel like I am being told my pain is not as intense as I am describing it to be. Dr. Park recommended that I work with their pain management team to see if there are any other methods to help. As my pain management appointment was about a month away, he told me to call and let them know that Dr. Park said I need an earlier appointment. Then he walked out of the room (while I was still in tears), on to his next patient. When I called the pain management office as instructed, they let me know there were no earlier appointments.

Ultimately, I am in the same position as before I went to see Dr. Park. Overall, I would not recommend him. He may be smart, but I did not feel that he had any genuine compassion toward my situation. I plan to schedule my 1 month follow up with a different surgeon.
